resources.string: Warm-Up: Begin with a 5-10 minute brisk walk or light jog to warm up your muscles and prepare your body for more intense activity. Running Session: Interval Running: Incorporate intervals of running and walking to gradually increase your endurance and stamina. Run at a moderate to fast pace for 2-3 minutes. Follow with a 1-2 minute brisk walk to recover. Repeat this cycle for 20-30 minutes, adjusting the intensity as needed. Continuous Run: Maintain a steady pace for a longer duration to improve cardiovascular fitness and endurance. Run at a comfortable pace for 20-30 minutes without stopping. Focus on maintaining a consistent rhythm and breathing pattern throughout the run.

Warm-Up: Start with a brisk walk for 5-10 minutes to warm up your muscles and prepare your body for jogging. Jogging Session: Interval Jogging: Alternate between jogging and walking to gradually build endurance. Jog for 2-3 minutes at a comfortable pace. Walk for 1-2 minutes to catch your breath and recover. Repeat this cycle for 20-30 minutes, depending on your fitness level. Steady Jog: Maintain a consistent pace for a longer duration. Jog at a comfortable pace for 15-20 minutes without stopping. Focus on your breathing and maintain good posture throughout the session.
